landing_page.intro_content: EOSIO를 기반으로 구축되었습니다. 지정 지분증명 방식(DPOS)는 미래 스마트 계약 블락체인의 핵심이 될 것입니다. 저희는 높은확장성과 빠른 거래처리 능력을 가진 EOSIO 소프트 웨어를 DPoS가 지속운영이 가능하도록 실질적인 탈중앙화 방식을 적용을 할 것입니다. Telos는 모든 블락체인에 대해 평등한 자금 분배를 할 것이며 이러한 토큰 분배를 통해 보다 네트워크가 보다 안정적이게 될 수 있습니다.
landing_page.developers_content: Telos 는 Dapps을 위한 세계 정상급의 안정적이고 비용절감이 가능한 네트워크를 제공하기 위해 고안되었습니다. 개발자들은 저렴한 RAM 가격을 기대할 수 있을 것이며 쉽게 오픈소스 또는 거래 수수료 없는 스마트 계약을 진행 할 수 있을 것입니다.
landing_page.dpos_content: Telos 네트워크는 최대 5000 TPS를 감당 할 수 있으며 이를 통해 빠른 거래처리 속도와 큰확장성을 가지고 있습니다. 이것이 의미하는 바는, 평균 최대 빠른 거래처리속도를 기준으로 했을 때 세계 모든이들에게 Dapps가 도달하는 시간이 단 1.5초밖에 걸리지 않는 획기적인 속도를 가지고 있습니다!
landing_page.gov_content: Telos 는 헌법을 참고하여 BP투표, 자금조달, 분쟁조정 med에 대한 다양한 통치방식을 가지고 있으며 그 어떤 블락체인도 Telos와 같은 통치방식을 제공하지 않습니다.
landing_page.white_paper_content: Telos 백서를 읽고 본인이 판단하는 몫만 남았습니다. 저희는 지금까지 없었던 블락체인을 구현해보고자 하며 저희 Telos 프로젝트에 동참해주시면 감사하겠습니다.

intro_paragraphs: Telos is a community-led alternative to EOS. We need you to help spread the word and make the Telos Network a success. You can share in the 1 million TLOS community rewards pool.

You can make videos, articles, tweets, posts, tutorials—just about anything that helps spread the word. Meetups, community management and more is all available and receives rewards both for the initial action and when people engage with you by liking, clapping, attending, viewing, whatever.

Once the Telos Network activates, you can submit a final list of your community engagement for your tokens. You can either supply us with your account name, or send us a Telos public key and new account name and we will create the account for you and fill it with your rewards!
Telos is a blockchain where your voice matters, so use that voice to tell everyone about the world changing advantages of the Telos Network.

column_one: All items subject to change and investigation. Gaming the system or getting rewards on a technicality will not be allowed.
Participants must register with the system portal above, providing their user names in the various platforms.
After network activation, participants will submit a final list of links and addresses for verification. Email instructions will be sent to all registered users prior to activation.
column_two: Submissions must be received within one week of Telos network activation
All participants who earn tokens will receive a free Telos Address!
All posts must include links to an official Telos website or Telos social media page:
column_three: All judges' determinations are final and cannot be appealed or arbitrated.
If the total amount earned by participants exceeds the 1 million TLOS allocated, then all timely submissions will be reduced in like percentage to pay each participant a pro rata share.
Participants may not also claim rewards from the Telos Founders Rewards Pool. They can only be a member of one or the other.

table_rows.task_category: Vimeo, Youtube, etc

table_rows.task: Telos 관련 작업 (일반적으로 지갑, 앱, 노드 등을 사용하는 방법)을 명확하고 간결하고 긍정적 인 방식으로 수행하는 방법을 보여주는 동영상

table_rows.task_category: Medium, Steemit, Reddit, Baidu Tieba article writing
table_rows.task: Reddit에서> 250 개의 단어 게시물 / 응답을 포함하여 Medium 또는 Steemit 및 비슷한 블로깅 사이트에 게시하십시오.
기술 툴 (블락체인 익스플로어, 툴 킷 등)
기사 작성은 Telos 및 / 또는 EOSIO 프로그래밍에서 Telos를 중립적 또는 긍정적 인 측면에서 두드러지게 언급하는 방법을 보여주기위한 것입니다.

table_rows.task_category: Instagram, image posts/work

table_rows.task: 포럼 그룹 관리 관련 기사 작성 및 답변 달기 등
table_rows.proof: 사용자이름과 함께 포럼링크와 자세한 작업 내용

table_rows.task: 밋업 주관 및 비슷한 소셜 그룹 창설

intro.heading: Telos 잃어버린 키 복구 포털
content: EOS에서 키가 분실 되었습니까? Telos는 곧 나오는 Telos sharedrop에서 적절한 소유자가 TLOS 토큰을 받게 하고자 합니다.

Telos는 원래 EOS ERC-20 스냅 샷 (계정 당 최대 40,000 개)을 기준으로 EOS 제네시스와 동일한 키 및 계정 이름을 사용하여 TLOS 토큰 1 : 1을 제공합니다. 키를 잃어 버리거나 손상된 사람은 Telos 체인에서 키를 교체할 수 있습니다. 그렇기에 저희는 EOS 제네시스 시점에 토큰을 보유한 사람들 에게 텔로스 네트워크 내에선 필요 시 키를 수정할 수 있는 방안을 고려하도록 건의하고 있습니다.

키 교체 절차는 Telos 메인 넷이 시작되기 전에 발생해야합니다. Telos는 원래의 ERC-20 스냅 샷을 사용하기 때문에 EOS가 시작된 후 계정에 발생한 피싱 또는 기타 키 손실을 우회하여 해당 키를 보유한 Ethereum 주소를 기반으로 소유권을 확인할 수 있습니다. EOS 계정을 잃어버린 사람이 새로운 Telos 계정을 관리 할 수 ​​있도록 특별한 시간을 가지고자 합니다.
확실히 말씀 드리고 싶은 부분은 Telos는 Telos 블록 체인에서 손실되거나 손상된 계정 만 보호 할 수 있습니다. 유감스럽게도 EOS 계정에서 생긴 문제는 저희가 어떻게 할 수 있는 부분이 없습니다.

process_one.two_processes_heading: 키 복구에는 두 가지 프로세스가 있습니다.
process_one.heading: 프로세스 1
process_intro: EOS ERC-20 토큰을 등록했지만 나중에 키를 분실하거나 손상된 사용자를위한 프로세스입니다. 98 %의 사용자에게 적용되므로 적절한 방법 일 것입니다.
스냅 샷에서 EOS 토큰을 보유한 동일한 주소에서 Ethereum 블록 체인의 메시지에 서명을 진행합니다. 이 메시지에는 사용자가 선택하는 지갑에서 새로운 퍼블릭 키가 포함 되어 있습니다. Sqrl예제를 보시고 따라하시면 됩니다. Sq기을 통해 EOS 또는 TLOS로 시작하는 퍼블릭 키를 생성할 수 있습니다.
퍼블릭 키의 프라이벗 키를 꼭 저장하시고 저희에게 이더리움 주소와 OES 퍼블릭 키를 전송해주세요. 저희쪽에서 메시지를 확인하고 키를 변경해드리겠습니다.

step_two.step: 새로운 텔로스 계정에서 새로운 키를 생성하세요.
screenshot_captions: SQRL 지갑을 실행하고 "Generate Key" 버튼 클릭하기, 다른 설정을 할 필요 없음.
"Generate Key"는 한쌍의 키를 바로 생성합니다. 이 키쌍은 Telos recovery(텔로스 복구)에 사용하게 될 것입니다. 또한 sharedrop(공유드롭(직역))이 후 본인의 Telos 계정으로도 사용됩니다.

키 복사전 보안을 위해 인터넷 연결을 해제한 상태에서 진행할 것을 권장합니다. 키가 있는 영역을 클릭하면 자동으로 복사가 됩니다. 키쌍을를 복사하여 메모장 또는 다른 형식으로 잘 보관하시기 바랍니다. 지금 저장하지 않으면 이후 단계에서 저장할 기회가 없습니다. 위 그림은 메모장에 복사한 예시입니다. 개인키(Private key)는 어느 누구에게도 제공 또는 노출하지 마세요~! 진행 과정에서 저장을 하지 못하고 지나치거나 창을 닫은 경우, 다시 새로운 키쌍을 생성하시면 됩니다.

현재까지의 과정을 요약하면,

  • SQRL 지갑을 실행하고 "Generate Key"를 클릭하여 새로운 키 생성하기
  • Public(공개) 및 Private(개인) 키 저장하기

본 과정이 끝나면 이제 Telos 계정 생성이 완료된 것이며 이후 Telo가 정식 런칭되면 본 과정에서 생성한 계정과 키를 이용하여 TLOS 토큰을 사용할 수 있게 됩니다.

step_three.step: 다음은 링크를 이용하여 현재 EOS 토큰이 저장된 이더리움 지갑을 이용하여야 합니다. https://www.myetherwallet.com/signmsg.html 링크를 클릭하면(필요시 로그인 하드웨어 지갑은 필요없음) 다음과 같은 화면을 확인할 수 있습니다:
step_three.copy_paste: 그리고, 아래의 문장을 복사하여 "Message"에 붙여넣기를 합니다(아래 그림 참고): - 아래 -
step_three.message: 암호호된 ethereum 주소 소유자 ( "Ethereum Address")로서 본인은이 주소와 관련된 EOS ERC-20 스냅 샷에 찍힌 EOS 토큰을 소유하고 있으며 이에 따라 본인의 계정에 대한 공개 키를 요청합니다. 아래의 새로운 EOS 공개 키 ( "New EOS Public Key") 또는 Telos 네트워크의 해당 계정에 해당하는 Telos 네트워크 주소로 변경하고자 합니다.  본인은이 요청을 통해 Telos Network 및 그 회원 (향후 동일한 가치의 스냅 샷을 나중에 사용할 수있는 블록 체인 프로젝트 포함)에 공개하는 데 동의합니다. 이 문서의 암호화 서명은 법적인 디지털 서명이며 모든 법관할 지역에서 유효합니다.
step_three.screenshot_caption:
붙여넣기를 하였다면, 위 그림에서 표시된 상자에 이더리움의 공개(PUBLIC) 키(주소)와 앞 단계 1과 2에서 생성한 EOS 공개(PUBLIC) 키(주소) 각각 입력하시기 바랍니다.

  • "Ethereum Address(이더리움 주소)"는 기존에 EOS를 받은 또는 저장한 공개키를 사용하여야 합니다.
  • "New Eos Key(새로운 이오스키)"는 위 절차 1, 2에서 SQRL 지갑을 이용하여 생성한 공개키를 복사하여 붙여넣기 하시기 바랍니다. (앞 단계의 이미지 예에서 EOS5…. 로 시작하는 주소가 공개(public)키 입니다.)

계속해서 같은 화면에서 아래의 리스트에서 본인이 사용한 이더리움 지갑을(Message 박스에 입력한 지갑주소와 동일한) 선택합니다.
step_three.screenshot_caption_two: 지갑을 선택하고 로그인 또는 인증(하드 지갑의 경우)이 되면 아래의 그림 처럼 "Sign Message" 버튼이 있는 화면으로 전환됩니다. 다시한번, 앞서 입력한 이더리움 공개키(주소)와 새로운 EOS 공개키(주소)를 확인한 후 "Sign message" 버튼을 클릭하시기 바랍니다.
step_three.screenshot_caption_three: "Sign Message" 버튼을 클릭하였다면, 아래와 같은 화면으로 전환됩니다. 본 절차를 완료하기 위해서 아래의 표시된 "Signature" 박스안 내용을 모두 복사 후 아래의 양식에 붙여넣기 하시기 바랍니다. 양식(아래 "TELOS RECOVERY PAGE"을 클릭하면 양식 페이지로 이동함) 작성 시 본인의 이메일 주소를 정확하게 입력하시기 바랍니다. 현재 이메일만이 저희가 연락을 할 수 있는 유일한 방법이며, 문제가 발생하거나 공지 시 사용됩니다.
step_three.email_us: 조사 할 수 있도록 귀하의 정보를 이메일로 보내주십시오.

process_one.process_note: 노트: Telos 관계자 어느 누구도 private 키(개인키)를 요청하지 않습니다! Telos는 입력하신 이메일 주소로 본 과정을 다시 진행할 것을 요청하거나 도움을 주기 위한 내용만을 포함할 것입니다.

process_two.heading: 프로세스 2
process_intro: 이 과정은 제네시스 스냅 샷 이전에 블록 1로 EOS ERC-20 토큰을 등록한 적이없는 사람들을위한 것입니다. 비공개 키를 입력해야하기 때문에 EOS Authority로 연결됩니다. EOS Autority는블록 생산자이며 검증프로세스를 개발했으며 이는EOS 네트워크와 TELOS 네트워크 모두에서 구동이 가능합니다.
process_two.save_keys: SQRL 지갑 계좌에 해당 키를 저장하십시오.
process_two.import_wallet: 네트워크가 시작되면 SQRL을 통해 지갑을 가져옵니다.

recovery_form.heading: 본인의 정보를 입력해주세요.
recovery_form.ethereum_label: 복사된 메시지를 볼 수 있는 EOS가 저장된 지갑주소
recovery_form.generated_label: TLOS를 수령 받고자 하는 새로 생선된 Telos (또는 EOS) 지갑 주소

intro.heading: Downloads
intro.subheading: Download all the documents and tools that you need to join the Telos Network.

wallets.heading: Telos Wallets
wallets.subheading: Choose a wallet to store and trade your TLOS tokens.
wallets.sqrl_description: Sqrl is a fully functional light wallet designed for the TELOS blockchain. This application can be used to connect to a remote TELOS API endpoint to perform producer voting actions and common wallet commands.

white_paper.description: We are out to create the best blockchain ever - read the white paper to judge for yourself. Join us and build on Telos.

press_kit.description: Everything you need to know about Telos in one PDF.

style_guide.description: A style guide featuring Telos Foundation logos, color palettes and fonts for brand use.

voting_guide.description: A guide to executing all the Telos Foundation Board voting functions available on Sqrl wallet.

logos_icons.description: A package containing an assortment of file sizes and types for the Telos logo and icon.

banners.heading: Telos Article Splash Banners
banners.subheading: Splash Banner art for use in online articles about Telos.

intro.heading: Build Your Dapp on Telos
intro.subheading: The best network makes the best Dapps
intro_content: Telos uses the power of EOSIO to deploy fast, high-capacity dapps with no transaction fees for users. Telos is 100% code compatible with EOS but dapps cost 30X less to deploy on Telos, and Telos provides free user accounts. This makes Telos an ideal on-ramp for developers looking to build third-generation blockchain apps at a low price. Read more about the low cost of Telos dapp deployment.

We are building a repository of sample contracts for new tokens, migration of existing tokens from Ethereum or EOS, voting functions, and other Telos development concepts. We also have a strong developer community to offer help in our Telegram groups, especially Telos Dapp Development.
There is also an excellent tutorial series about deploying on Telos called SensorDApp.
intro.tutorials_description: Learn how to build your Dapp on the Telos network.
intro.smart_contracts_description: Write smart contracts that perform basic Telos functions such as exchanging tokens and casting votes.

gigs.heading: Decentralized gig economies
content: Decentralized gig economies - Telos will lead the emergence of a new and more equitable gig economy; imagine the possibilities of the next Uber or Airbnb led by community ownership and a decentralized workforce.

currency.heading: Currency
content: A stable currency on Telos will open up possibilities to billions of people around the world who don't have access to bank accounts, providing the transparency and decentralization that is needed to prevent financial meltdowns such as the 2008 economic crisis or Venezuela's extreme currency inflation.

records.heading: Decentralized records and information
content: Corruption can be prevented when records are open, transparent and immutable. Information quality can be enhanced by aligned incentive and community efforts. Telos can support vital documents including home ownership registers, medical records, or the next community encyclopedia.

compatibility.heading: EOS Compatibility
content: EOSIO is currently responsible for half of all blockchain transactions and its development is expected to advance faster than older platforms like Ethereum and NEO. The Telos network runs the same EOSIO software as EOS, so Dapps written for EOS can run on Telos. No rewrite needed!

powerful.heading: Powerful performance for decentralized Dapp development
content: Telos facilitates incredibly fast and free transactions to establish a stable and affordable market for Dapp development. RAM supply will be scaled with actual usage in order to ensure affordability and prevent hoarding. Telos tokens have more than three times the resource utility of EOS, and developers will be able to purchase and stake resources such as CPU and bandwidth on behalf of users.

secure.heading: Secure and robust network
content: Telos expands on the EOS network by enforcing additional disclosure requirements and minimum requirements for Telos block producers, who must maintain a full and open testnet in order to support Dapp development. Nonfunctioning block producers are temporarily swapped out after missing just 30 minutes, as opposed to 3 hours on the EOS mainnet, so that developers encounter fewer pauses and problems without compromising security. Fair pay ensures all active and standby block producers are ready to produce at all times for maximum performance and stability.

proprietary.heading: Dapps can be proprietary code
content: Protect your intellectual property with Telos. Unlike EOS, Telos will not force all developers to open source their contract code. This allows commercial Dapp makers to keep other developers from simply copying their work.

decentralized.heading: Decentralized Governance and Arbitration
content: Telos has the most decentralized ownership of any blockchain existing today. No individual or entity will start with, or is likely to ever own, even one percent of the Telos blockchain. Telos’ decentralized voting system ensures that the blockchain is guided by the will of the community and the steady hand of the most competent block producers.

Telos will have a fully developed and ratified Network Operating Agreement and Telos Arbitration Organization (TAO) upon launch. These entities will ensure that conflicts are resolved in a timely manner so that developers can focus on Dapps instead of disputes.

intro.heading: Governance Overview
intro.subheading: Telos is a governed blockchain based on EOSIO - the same software that powers EOS - so that Dapps can deploy on Telos and EOS with the same code. When Telos launches (as early as December 4, 2018) it will have complete documentation and operating structures such as full on-chain governance, the ability to ratify or amend the governance documents by community voting, a worker proposal system, and election of block producers and arbitrators. Below are the main elements and features of blockchain governance on Telos.

documents.heading: THE DOCUMENTS
documents.subheading: The definitions, rules, and procedures of Telos governance are contained in six documents that will be recorded on-chain and modifiable by community vote (pro rata by TLOS token ownership). These documents are:

operating_agreement.long_description: The prime governing document on Telos describing the rights and responsibilities of becoming a member of the Telos Blockchain Network. It is required to opt-in to this agreement in order to access or use Telos. This agreement is the equivalent of the EOS Constitution. It differs from the EOS constitution in form: The TBNOA thoroughly defines all network parts and participants and describes governance actions such as electing block producers, amending the governance documents or submitting a worker proposal system submission. The TBNOA has inherited almost no terms from the EOS Constitution. The TBNOA includes the other five governance documents by reference and each of them adopts its definitions and terms.

arbitration_rules.long_description: The Arbitration Rules & Procedures describes the entire process of arbitration on Telos - from filing a case to procedures for arbitration, to delivery of arbitral judges decisions to block producers for execution. The EOS analog for this is the ECAF Rules and as yet unpublished ECAF Handbook. the Telos Arbitration Rules are entirely independent from the ECAF Rules and share no text. They are also a community amendable core governance document on Telos, whereas the ECAF Rules are set and maintained by the ECAF with no mechanism for input or control from the broader EOS community.
arbitration_rules.short_description: Rules and procedures for arbitration on Telos

regproducer_contract.long_description: The 'regproducer' contract is used by any member desiring to become a block producer candidate to nominate themselves. The human-language terms of this contract set out the responsibilities and rules for block producer candidates. This text is largely inherited from the EOS 'regproducer' contract with much additional text added. The primary difference between the EOS and Telos versions is that while both list prohibited actions, the Telos version also documents penalties for any infractions, the method of enforcement, and the responsibility of block producers to enforce the rules on other BPs.
regproducer_contract.short_description: Rules, responsibilities and representations of block producers

bp_minimums.long_description: The BP Minimum Requirements is a list of disclosures, practices, equipment and networking standards that block producer candidates must adhere to in order to serve. Failure to meet the minimum requirements disqualifies a BP from service until the omission is cured, regardless of how many votes the BP has acquired. Due to the newness of the network, these requirements are described in increasingly stringent phases which the block producers can vote to move between based on 2/3 + 1 voting. EOS does not have minimum requirements or a similar document. A minimum amount of RAM is specified in the EOS 'regproducer' contract.
bp_minimums.short_description: Minimum requirements to act as a block producer

regarb_contract.long_description: The 'regarb' contract is used by any member desiring to become an arbitrator candidate to nominate themselves. The human-language terms of this contract set out the responsibilities and rules for arbitrator candidates. There is no similar document on EOS because EOS does not elect arbitrators.
regarb_contract.short_description: Rules, responsibilities and representations of arbitrators

arbitrator_minimums.long_description: The Arbitrator Minimum Requirements is a list of disclosures, practices, equipment and networking standards that arbitrator candidates must adhere to in order to serve. Failure to meet the minimum requirements disqualifies an arbitrator from being assigned new cases until the omission is cured, regardless of how many votes the arbitrator candidate has acquired. Due to the newness of the network, these requirements are described in increasingly stringent phases. There is no similar document on EOS because EOS does not elect arbitrators.
arbitrator_minimums.short_description: Minimum requirements to act as an arbitrator

intro.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
intro.subheading: These FAQs do not provide legal advice and are for educational purposes only. You can find more information on our GitHub repository and Medium page.

faqs.question: How Do I Get My TLOS?
answer: TLOS will first be airdropped to all users with addresses in the EOS genesis snapshot, and account holders can access their TLOS tokens upon activation of the Telos Blockchain Network. If you cannot access your EOS account, recover your lost keys here: https://telosfoundation.io/recovery.

You will also be able to access TLOS tokens with Sqrl, the wallet of Telos. Scatter and DEXEOS will be listing a TLOS/EOS pair, Chainrift will list a  TLOS/BTC pair, and more exchanges are expected to announce their support as well.
Sign up for a free account here: https://telosfoundation.io/downloads

faqs.question: What is Telos?
answer: Telos is a new blockchain network based on EOSIO software.

faqs.question: What is the difference between EOS and Telos?
answer: EOS and Telos are both networks running the EOSIO software. Any smart contract that runs on one system should run equally well on the other. Telos has modified the EOS genesis snapshot and some rules to make the network more responsible to the majority of token holders, to be more attractive to DApp developers, and to generally run more responsibly and sustainably.

faqs.question: What is TLOS?
answer: TLOS is the name of the token that reflects ownership in Telos. A TLOS token is like an EOS token except that there will be around 3X fewer TLOS tokens than EOS.

faqs.question: If I bought EOS tokens, will I get TLOS?
answer: Yes, if you bought EOS and registered them, then your TLOS tokens will be available for voting at the network launch and for transfer or stake as soon as the network activates – up to 40,000 TLOS per address. If your tokens are on an exchange, the exchange must agree to list TLOS and distribute tokens to owners for you to receive them.

faqs.question: Are you taking away people’s EOS tokens?
answer: No. EOS holders will have the exact same number of EOS tokens on the EOS network as they ever had. That is what they purchased from Block.one. Telos is a new project based on the EOS network. The EOS source code is open source and freely available to fork. We have decided to give an equal number of TLOS tokens to every EOS token holder on the genesis snapshot, but capping values at 40,000 TLOS per genesis address. This means that there will be no whales on Telos.

faqs.question: Is Telos an airdrop?
answer: Telos is a completely new network using the same EOSIO operating software as EOS mainnet with a few small modifications. It is not an airdrop. However, the distribution of TLOS tokens is similar to an airdrop in that anyone who owned EOS tokens will receive new TLOS tokens at their addresses based on our genesis token distribution algorithm.

faqs.question: What exactly is the Telos genesis token distribution algorithm?
answer: Simply, it is that all Telos genesis addresses will receive the same number of tokens as their corresponding EOS addresses held in the genesis snapshot—up to a maximum of 40,000 tokens. There are a few exceptions to this policy: Addresses proven to have been stolen, phished, or misregistered, thereby depriving their rightful owners of them, will be restored to new addresses controlled by their rightful owners; and new genesis tokens will be created to compensate the Active Block Producers (ABPs) and establish the Telos Foundation.

faqs.question: If you cap all accounts, how can EOS holders get TLOS from exchanges?
answer: The TLOS block producers have the ability to create new tokens by a vote of 2/3+1. The 6 ABPs agree to create new tokens for distribution for any exchange that can show EOS holdings on the snapshot and that agrees: to list TLOS; not to vote the exchange account; and to request and distribute only enough coins so that all EOS holders at the time of the snapshot receive their coins capped at 40,000 per account. The ABPs will have a process in place for exchanges to petition them to create TLOS tokens and promise to honor all valid petitions. (It will require a vote of 5 of the 6 block producers to accomplish this.) Once Telos activates and the elected block producers validate the network, it will take a vote of 15 of the 21 block producers to create new tokens for exchanges.

faqs.question: Why cap genesis addresses at 40,000 TLOS?
answer: The largest 1,050 EOS addresses control about 90% of EOS tokens and therefore completely control block producer selection, their voting, and ultimately the entire network. This makes the system dangerously centralized. By capping genesis addresses at 40,000 TLOS — approximately the 90th percentile of ownership — Telos will be one of the most evenly distributed major blockchains in existence. 162,930 addresses will have exactly as many TLOS as they did EOS. The total TLOS token supply will be lowered to approximately 200-400,000,000 TLOS tokens depending on how many exchanges petition to recreate their wallets. Read More Here: Telos Token Distribution — Use of the EOS Genesis Snapshot & Why

faqs.question: Can Telos addresses ever have more than 40,000 TLOS?
answer: Yes. The 40,000 TLOS cap only applies at the network genesis. Addresses may hold any amount of TLOS thereafter.

faqs.question: What is the difference between the Telos launch and activation?
answer: Telos launch is the process of beginning to run Telos to allow votes to be cast for block producers and for network validation. Activation is the point when TLOS holders can begin transferring or otherwise controlling their tokens beyond just voting.

faqs.question: If exchange addresses cannot vote, will my TLOS tokens be able to vote if they are currently on an exchange?
answer: Once tokens are off the exchange and on your own Telos address, you can vote them. Individual owners cannot vote their tokens held on exchanges. Preventing voting from exchange accounts keeps exchanges from voting with customer tokens, which is against the Telos rules.

faqs.question: Will this hurt the EOS network?
answer: The EOS network will succeed or fail based on its own merits. We hope it succeeds, as we are all deeply invested in this project. However, the EOS mainnet release has revealed problems with the system that will be difficult to resolve on the EOS blockchain. “Whales” have shown that they generally just vote for their own block producer partners and even game the rewards system to harm other block producers— this may also be expected once worker proposals emerge. The EOS network is under the control of a few whale accounts. We offer a fresh approach where all token holders’ voices matter. Telos also hopes to provide a testbed for new ideas that may eventually be adopted by the EOS mainnet. In this way we hope to strengthen EOS.

faqs.question: If these changes will fix the network, why doesn’t EOS make them?
answer: Block.one sold EOS tokens in their tokensale. They accepted money for tokens and made certain representations. They can’t easily change the results of their sale—especially by reducing the tokens of their largest contributors, which is really the key change that fixes the system. Telos is a completely new system that never took money from nor made promises to anyone. We intend to build a network using the open source EOS software (that we all helped pay for) to create an entirely new network that better represents the true purpose of EOS.

faqs.question: Can I buy and sell TLOS tokens? What are they worth?
answer: TLOS tokens will not gain value until the Telos mainnet launches and they are able to be traded. In practical terms, TLOS will gain real value when exchanges accept them to trade against other cryptocurrencies. We expect that this will happen because exchange customers will demand that they be given access to their tokens. The technical requirements for listing TLOS will be identical to EOS so we expect little resistance on that point. Once tokens are freely trading on exchanges they will find their value based on supply and demand. The TLOS token supply will be between one-fifth and one-third that of EOS, and Telos should be as good as or better than EOS. Telos will also not have any “whale” addresses which often are responsible for price manipulations in other coins.

faqs.question: Are you selling TLOS tokens?
answer: We are not selling any TLOS tokens. We will use the EOS Snapshot with the following changes: 1) Capping all addresses at 40,000; 2) Creating a process for exchange addresses to petition the BPs to create TLOS tokens for their EOS snapshot owners by listing and distributing TLOS tokens (up to 40,000 per account holder); 3) Providing new public keys to EOS token holders who can prove that their tokens were stolen or misregistered; 4) Adding 6M new tokens to form a Telos Founders Reward Pool and 6M TLOS tokens to the Telos Foundation Ltd, to support network needs that cannot otherwise be funded. These tokens currently have no value and will only gain value if the ABPs and Telos Foundation can create a valuable network. The Telos Foundation pledges to never vote its tokens.

faqs.question: Who are you and why are you launching Telos?
answer: We are a group of EOS block producer candidates who have contributed to the system, run testnets, and taken part in the EOS Mainnet Launch Group that voted to unanimously launch the mainnet. We believe in the promise of EOS, but we have come to be concerned that the current system is deeply flawed due to the overwhelming power of EOS token holders with enormous holdings. We hope that EOS can overcome this problem, but in the meantime, we want to launch a new and more decentralized network using the EOS technology.

faqs.question: Can EOS block producers also be Telos block producers?
answer: Absolutely! We hope they will since they know how to run EOSIO nodes well. Anyone who meets the minimum requirements for a Telos block producer may submit themselves for voting.

faqs.question: Can developers make their code proprietary?
answer: Yes. If the developer has not accepted payment as a block producer, code reviewer, or worker proposal recipient in the past six months, they can designate the original code in a DApp as proprietary. Any underlying open source code that the DApp is built upon will remain open source, of course. By contrast, all smart contracts running on the EOS network must be open source according to the EOS Constitution.

faqs.question: What if Telos users don’t want to use proprietary software on the blockchain?
answer: Each smart contract will designate if portions of its code are proprietary. Telos members will be able to choose whether or not they wish to work with proprietary smart contracts or only open source contracts.

faqs.question: How are Telos block producers paid?
answer: Telos will have 21 ABPs and up to 30 standby block producers sharing the 1% TLOS inflation. Each block producer will be paid the same flat rate and each standby will be one half of that rate. All will receive pay deductions for missed blocks.

faqs.question: Will the team launching Telos take a fee for its service?
answer: Launching Telos is an expensive and time-consuming venture. The people launching Telos include block producers, developers, social media marketers, arbitrators, and others working together in a largely decentralized way. Members of the Telos Launch Group will be compensated in the TLOS genesis file. A Telos Founders Reward Pool (TFRP) will be created in the Telos genesis file containing 6M TLOS (about 1.8% of the expected money supply). This fund will be distributed among members of the Telos Launch Group – an open-membership group established to create and launch Telos – based on tasks performed by members. The exact method of TFRP distribution is yet to be determined but will be formalized prior to network launch.

faqs.question: You say that Telos won’t have any “whales” but aren’t the TFRP recipients and Telos Foundation going to become whales?
answer: The Telos Foundation will never vote its tokens. TFRP funds will be broadly distributed among contributors in a manner to be determined soon. Distributions over a certain amount will unlock evenly over a 3-year period similar to how Block.one’s tokens vest. No TFRP recipient will be able to vote itself into the block producer ranks without the help of many TLOS token holders.

faqs.question: Why are TLG members being compensated?
answer: Members of the Telos Launch Group are taking a central role in creating and launching Telos. They are bearing the costs and contributing the effort to bring the network to life. To compensate their work and defray cost they incur, they are being granted new genesis tokens on the Telos blockchain distributed from the Telos Founders Reserve Pool. These tokens are of zero value at the genesis and will only gain value if the TLG, Telos Foundation, and other participants can launch a valuable network. This approach is in line with bounty programs common in cryptocurrency launches. The total amount of compensation for the many founders/bounty recipients is ~1.8% of the expected TLOS token supply, which is a low number for cryptocurrency projects where large amounts of work are required and no funding has been sought.

faqs.question: What is the Telos Foundation?
answer: The Telos Foundation is the organization initially launching Telos. Prior to the Telos mainnet launch, the Telos Foundation will organize technical, informational, and marketing efforts to advance Telos. The Telos Foundation will manage the Telos genesis file that is subject to validation by the 6 ABPs. Immediately upon the mainnet launch, the Telos Foundation will cede its authority to the 6 ABPs to be governed by the Telos Constitution and voting rules. After mainnet launch, the Telos Foundation will function as an independent promotion and funding body for Telos. Its function will be to pay for projects that are not selected for worker proposals or that cannot yet be funded due to inadequate funds (particularly early in the life of the network.) The Telos Foundation may apply for worker proposal funds to reimburse funds dispersed as the goal is to create an ongoing fund that is not depleted. It will also seek to stabilize RAM prices by regularly publishing a guidance price and buying below that price, selling above it, and offering RAM for sale or lease to bona fide developers seeking to develop on the network. The Telos Foundation is a decentralized organization that votes on its own issues via smart contract. It does not serve or seek any official governance position and will remain neutral on block producer candidates and proposals. Addresses owned by the Telos Foundation will never vote.

intro.heading: Arbitrator Program
body: The Telos Network is the world’s first governed blockchain with arbitrators elected by its members. We are looking for legal professionals from around the world to help us build this system into the model for all future blockchain governance and arbitration.

Arbitrators may be individuals, teams, or firms who nominate themselves by executing the regarbitrator contract. Arbitrators are selected by the votes of TLOS token-holders and are paid arbitration fees in TLOS. At launch, this page will hold the campaign statements of every arbitrator candidate to facilitate voting. At present, the site shows sample statements and statements from any who notify us of their intent to campaign.

documents.title: Telos Arbitration Process Document
description: This document outlines how the arbitration of disputes and interventions to change account or contract values will be administered on the Telos Network.

documents.title: Telos Arbitrators Minimum Requirements
description: All arbitrators must meet minimum requirements to ensure that they are qualified to settle disputes on the Telos Network.

documents.title: regarbitrator human-language contract
description: All arbitrators must agree to fulfill the terms outlined in this smart contract.

contact.heading: If you are interested in becoming an arbitrator on the Telos Network, please contact us.

elected_arbitrators.name: Blake Lagarde
statement: Having received a B.S. Biological Sciences (2007) and a B.S. Nursing (2010) from Louisiana State University, Blake Lagarde’s journey towards arbitration candidacy is a unique one. He has spent his decade long professional career as a Registered Nurse, presently at Children’s Hospital in his home town of New Orleans. What he lacks in traditional law practice is made up by first hand experience with and a passion for EOS and Telos (and Ethereum by proxy) blockchain token recovery. Nearly 2 weeks after the EOS Genesis Snapshot and Mainnet launch, Blake personally created the now 1,300 member EOS Lost Non-Compromised (Genesis) Key Group on Telegram--an EOS 911 partner. He has also served as an administrator for the 2,200 member EOS 911, known together with the former as the "EOS Lost Key Community." He has led the effort to find a solution for those with lost non-compromised genesis keys (as well as some fringe cases). He penned the EOS Lost Key Petition which has garnered the support and signature of over 1,700+ individuals. Through Blake’s personal outreach the Lost Key movement has also received endorsement or support from over 30 EOS Block Producers, many of whom fill the ‘Top 21’ today. Because of the work in and commitment to the EOS Lost Key community, he was approached by Douglas Horn to join the Telos Launch Group (TLG) with a focus on token recovery.

Per Douglas Horn, as a member of the TLG, "[Blake has] been an important part of [telos launch group]. [Blake] brought a lot of credibility for us in the Lost Key community at a time when people still did not know whether they could trust us. For those who do not know, Blake played a key role in getting the ECAF to reach out to their entire email list about Telos key recovery. And he diligently worked with people who were having problems [with telos token recovery] He also prevented a lot of thefts from people testing our process."

From pioneering the EOS lost key effort, to being the first EOS holder to receive a lost key claim ruling from the ECAF, and personally working on telos token recovery support and validation; the next logical step in Blake’s intimate journey through the world of cryptocurrency and lost or stolen private keys is to become an official Telos Arbitrator.  To date, Blake has already assisted 160 individuals recover their 300,000+ telos tokens.  He looks forward to the future as an opportunity to continue to help those with blockchain issues on a more official basis.

When Blake is not advocating for those with lost keys, his time is spent with his life partner of ten year, Dr. Anneliese Boettcher (PhD Neuropsychology), and their two beautiful mutts Hubie (in picture) and Sula.  When Blake and Anna are not at a music festival or catching a local artist play a show, they are both active members in NOLA’s Mental Health Advocacy Sources, such as the Brett Thomas Doussan Foundation, with a focus on suicide prevention.

elected_arbitrators.name: Justin Yashouafar
statement: Justin.arb is owned 100% by Justin Yashouafar.
Justin Yashouafar  is  a Managing  Partner at  Blockhead Capital,  a blockchain  and cryptoasset focused investment fund.   He  is  also  a member  of  the EOSVibes  block producer.

Justin attended  the University  of  Southern  California, where he  earned  a Bachelor  of  Science in  Business Administration. He  later continued his education at  UCLA School  of  Law,  where he  earned  his Juris Doctor degree with  a specialization  in  Business  Law.  Following law school, Justin  practiced full  time  as  a transactional attorney  at  a large United  States  based law firm, where he counseled and advised family  offices,  institutional funds, and publicly  traded  investment  trusts, as  well  as  seed  and growth  stage companies including WeWork, Cross Campus, and Mitú.

Justin first learned about and began researching Bitcoin in  2011. In  the summer  of 2016, together  with  several investment  banking peers,  he  developed a thesis  to invest  in  Bitcoin as  a hedge against sovereign currency  collapse, potential hyperinflation, and a mounting  global  debt  crisis. After deploying capital based on this  thesis, Justin  fell  down  the crypto  rabbit  hole  when  he  learned about the industry-shifting potential of  smart-contract  enabled blockchain  platforms.

In November  2018, realizing the issues  with  the EOS first chain’s constitution, Justin drafted and proposed  a new EOS Constitution to the community.  Justin  has been involved  with  eosio blockchains since inception and is  excited to  work  to  make Telos one of  the best  iterations  of  eosio – with  the goal  to  make  it  the best  platform to  launch  and run successful  dApps.

elected_arbitrators.name: Chijioke Ilochonwu
statement: My name is Chijioke Ilochonwu, also known as FINANCIALFREEDOMCJ from my Youtube channel @ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UcaoILL2Xi3oAZak0daSi0Rw with over 200 subscribers. The channel focuses on different ways to achieve financial freedom, but is moreso focused on cryptocurrency which I believe holds the potential for regular folks to achieve financial freedom. I have been a big believer in EOSIO ecosystem since Dan Larimer introduced it in 2017 and to date it represents my largest portfolio of holdings in the cryptospace. Having observed the limitations of other smart contract platforms, I knew EOS was going to be the game changer. After the launch of EOS and the various issues that came up, I was bit disappointed until I heard about the Telos network. Once I found out about the EOSIO code software fork, Telos, I went and read the White Paper by Douglas Horn, it's author and architect. I read it several times because what I was reading was what I signed up for when I joined the EOSIO movement. I was immeditely sold on the vision! I became one of the earliest community members promoting the Telos Blockchain Network heavily on different social media platforms. I wrote more than 33 articles and made videos about the Telos Blockchain Network movement which can been seen @
https://trybe.one/members/financialfreedomcj
https://www.reddit.com/user/financlfreedomcj/
https://twitter.com/financfreedomcj
https://medium.com/@financialfreedomcj
https://steemit.com/@financlfreedomcj
https://whaleshares.io/@financlfreedomcj
https://financialfreedomcj.quora.com/
https://deals.weku.io/@financlfreedomcj

Because of my passion for the Telos project, I became one of the very few community members that earned the highest amount of Telos tokens (TLOS) in the Telos Community Rewards Pool (TCRP) by promoting Telos. I am one of the very few community members not involved in the Telos Launch Group (TLG) to earn the highest amount of the highly coveted Telos Foundation Voting Tokens (TFVT) available for the Telos Community Rewards Pool (TCRP). Only about one hundred and twenty plus members have possession of these highly coveted tokens. Also, I was one of the very few community members outside of the Telos Launch Group (TLG) to become a Telos Foundation Board nominee.

I am currently the owner of Nobles, a shipping and logistics company that cordinates the movement goods and services overseas with over a million dollars in gross revenue. I have a bachelors degree in Pure and Industrial Chemistry from University of PortHarcourt, Nigeria. Originally from Nigeria, I am a naturalized citizen of the USA. My journey to who I am and what I have become today, although not an easy one, proves that the American Dream is still possible for those with dreams in their heart. I came into United States with twenty dollars in my pocket and a big dream in my heart. I worked menial jobs to make ends meet during my first few years in the country.

Finally, I found a career as a Quality Chemist for Pure Labs, a division of Boumatic, a multi million dollar dairy equipment and chemical company in Madison, WI, USA. I was influential in crafting the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the whole chemical division. Eventually, I became the plant supervisor for Boumatic years later, but the itch to launch my own company would not allow me to settle for anything less. This desire and drive led me to eventually leave the company to focus on Nobles full time. One of my fellow supervisors thought leaving my cushy job was one of the craziest moves because of security of the job. A year later I met this same supervisor, only to find out that our  supervisory division of the plant was closed and all my fellow supervisors and workers were given pink slips. Unbeknowst to me, a divine hand was guiding my family and I or this would have been my fate too! There is the saying that there is no security in a significant life and and no significance in a secure life.

My faith and personal relationship with Jesus Christ has carried me since I committed my life to Him during my last year of college in 1999 and definitely sustained me through those trying years in the States. I grew up in an entrepreneurial household back in Nigeria where we don't work for people but instead pioneer our own businesses. I got my first laptop when I arrived the United States; I kept saying that the computer and internet was going to change the world. My entrepreneurial journey led me to search for online businesses and through divine connections, I found a website called eHarmony.com. This was where I met my wife and we have been married going on fifteen years with three lovely kids. My wife and I did not know how to do anything online, even her email address started with nointernetforme. She found the most precious person in her life, me, through the thing she distrusted the most, the internet. What irony! Eventually, I founded Nobles and my dream of owning my own online business came to be.

I thought the internet was it until I discovered cryptocurrency and blockchain. Again, I kept saying that this was going to change the world just like the internet changed my life. The only difference this time is that I arrived early to this game. What a priviledge but also a huge responsibility! Everyone involved in cryptocurrency now will reap the great financial rewards in the future but more importantly is also entrusted with the responsibity to represent this revolution with integrity, truth and justice to our family, friends, and the world that are sceptics because of all that has gone wrong in this industry.

As you can see from my profile, what I lack in traditional law practice is made up by my determination, hardwork, and the perseverance to dream, to see where the future is going and to become part of that future revolution. Telos Network, which will be world's first governed blockchain with arbitrators elected by it's members, is the future and I would like to be part of this future by becoming one of the Telos Network Arbitrators!

elected_arbitrators.name: Mikko Ohtamaa
statement: Mikko is chief technical officer, open source advocate, blockchain developer.
Mikko brings his expertise of IT forensics and in-depth blockchain understanding to the arbitration panel.

Mikko is the CTO of TokenMarket, a crowdfunding platform. Before Mikko was the CTO of LocalBitcoins, a peer-to-peer bitcoin exchange. Mikko has extensive experience of resolving user disputes, gathering evidence, doing the technical investigation and chain analysis on cryptocurrency fraud and heists. Mikko is familiar with Financial Conduct Authority (UK), Finance Service Commission (Gibraltar) and Financial Action Task Force recommendations. Furthermore, Mikko keeps himself up to date international discussion of the legal status of cryptocurrencies and digital ledger technology.

Mikko has a long career in software development that he started with early mobile software in 1999. Later, Mikko moved to cryptography based systems and started with Bitcoin in 2013, and Ethereum in 2016. He has been contributing to Ethereum foundation projects and now looks to help Telos Foundation.  Before Mikko served in Plone Foundation, one of the oldest open source foundations, and helped to established Python Finland, a user group of open source developers.
Mikko holds MSc. in Industrial Engineering and Management from the University of Oulu.

candidates.name: Marc-Roger Gagné
statement: Marc-Roger Gagné is a prolific Data Governance Advocate who resides in Ottawa, Canada. Throughout the span of nearly two decades, Marc-Roger has been dedicated to providing top-notch policy advice for government and corporate clients alike. He is a member of the Board of Directors of the Privacy and Access Council of Canada since 2010 and a Member of the International Association of Privacy Professionals (817631). Additionally, he holds membership at the Compliance, Governance & Oversight Council, the Law Society of Upper Canada.

Marc-Roger’s accreditations are many. In 2011 he was recognized as a Master Access and Privacy Professional (MAPP), the highest designation in the Privacy  community. He also holds accreditations as a CIPP, CIPP/G, CIPP/C, Certified Cyber Threat Analyst (CCTA), Certified Cyber Intelligence Investigator (CCII), Certified Human Trafficking Investigator (CHTI) and Certified Cyber Threat Forensic Investigator (CTFI). His key competencies lie in Litigation, Privacy, Breach Management and Training Programs, Policy Development, Information Management, Informational Technology, Data Analytics.

Combining his vast knowledgebase along with his integrity, Marc-Roger is a well-recognized and respected professional who has integrated numerous innovative strategies into everything that he does in the privacy, data protection, and legal services fields.

candidates.name: Mariela Josefina Mej�as de Coronado
statement: Venezuelan nationality, resides in a town of the beautiful Capital City Barcelona Anzo�tegui state, a city with a history of heroes and liberators of great relevance for my country. I consider myself an excellent Arbiter of Telos, for being a woman who practices justice, love of neighbor, truth, respect, honesty, wisdom, humility, knowledge, with the vision of helping others, directing them , motivate them in the right way, the way of love and prosperity.

Systems Engineer by profession dedicated to Project Training and Consulting, Systems Analyst in the Higher Education area in the Faculty of Engineering at the Northeastern University of Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho in Venezuela.

Knowledge in Psychology Behavioral Therapist "LOGOTHERAPY", in Barcelona -Anzo�tegui, University Consortium: Central University of Nicaragua (UCN), National Academic Coordination, Universidad Cristiana del Sur. March 2009.
Brief familiarization about Telos Arbitration rules such as:
Limitation of authority
Default arbitration forum
Alternative arbitration forums
No Responsibility of the Referee
All final decisions
Classes of cases
Inclusion of precedents.
Identification of Additional Accounts.
Scope of the decision
Execution of the decision.
Basic knowledge about the mechanics of Blockchain and EOSIO; The most powerful infrastructure for decentralized applications.
NOTE: "I do not have any Telos currently."
Reflection:
Because there is only one God, and only one mediator between God and men, Jesus Christ man. 1 Timothy 2: 5
If we want to be a good Telos Referee, let us follow the example of Our Lord Jesus Christ, he is the master par excellence of arbitration, there is no one like him.
God continue to bless you and the love of Christ shine in your heart!
Ing. Mariela Mejias

candidates.name: Sean M. King (金世翔)
statement: Overview:

• CEO of EOSex Exchange (already listing and assisting several Telos projects)
  • 10yrs Legal & Governance Experience
  • Special Blockchain Advisor to Taiwan Congress
  • Core Member of Taiwan Blockchain SRO (Self-Regulatory Organization)
  • Fluent in English and Mandarin Chinese
  • Believe in open, transparent, and fair blockchain

I have over 10yrs of legal and corporate governance experience, and am currently CEO of EOSex, a crypto exchange that already lists several Telos and EOS-based projects, so I am already familiar with Telos projects, and very active and well-known among the Telos community. I am also currently special blockchain advisor to Taiwan congress, a core steering committee member for the Taiwan blockchain SelfRegulatory Organization (SRO), and a member of the working group that actually drafted the governance rules, the “Code of Conduct”, for exchanges under the Taiwan SRO. I am also fluent in English and Mandarin Chinese.
My governance Philosophy

I firmly believe in a transparent and decentralized blockchain where all disputes are handled in an open and “innocent until proven guilty” manner; where people should not be blacklisted without due process, as this goes against the spirit of blockchain which rejects arbitrary exclusion that we see in so many other parts of society; where users should have free access to their own funds, tokens, and accounts without interference unless clear evidence has been presented to the contrary, and unless the person in question has had a chance to dispute that evidence in a fair and open manner.
